snippet: Even before Edward J. Snowden arrived in a Moscow airport, Russia had been pressing for greater access to social networking and e-mail data.
abstract: Members of Russia's Parliament cite Edward J Snowden's leaks of classified information as part of renewed push for tighter government control of Internet; group hopes to compel global Internet companies like Google and Microsoft to comply with rules on personal data storage; experts say rules, in addition to protecting personal data, would provide back door for Russian law enforcement into services like Gmail.
lead_paragraph: Even before Edward J. Snowden arrived in a Moscow airport, Russia had been pressing for greater access to social networking and e-mail data.

headline.main: N.S.A. Leaks Revive Push in Russia to Control Net
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Leaks Revive Push In Russia to Control Net
